title: How does Fiora Parry work with suppression?
body:
if aimed right and timed right would it essentially brake the channel when it returns damage or would fiora not go into "suppressed" mode at all?
Just curios because google didn't answer my question

Edit: A rioter answered my question, oh happy days :)

replies.body: If Fiora's mid Riposte when an enemy uses a surpression like Malz ult on her she'll block the effect, basically in the same way a spellshield would.
By the way, is it intended that Tahm w(devour) doesn't go on cooldown when parried? I think it also doesn't go on cooldown when spellshielded, but not 100% sure on that.
Definitely not intended, we'll get that fixed.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3AkkBf6d,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-08-08T07:57:37.163+0000)
>
> Definitely not intended, we'll get that fixed.

to add to that, happened to me multiple times that while trying to devour a minion (can't recall it happening to champions), the skill went on cooldown but NOTHING happened at all

Haha! xD Had a Malz Top yesterday and did exactly this - oh he was such a salty boy.:P 
WasnÂ´t sure this interaction is intended, thank you Meddler. :)
Can confirm, managed to parry WW's ult.
hell. her riposte even nulls bard ult AND ignite...thats some spell shield indeed.
nothing stops surpression except olaf ult i believe

> [{quoted}](name=agbudar,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=3AkkBf6d,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-08-08T07:32:34.652+0000)
>
> nothing stops surpression except olaf ult i believe

Ali's ult and Fiora's riposte
I actually got really lucky with this one game, I parried right at the perfect moment, countered malz ult and killed him while barely living XD
